abstract.text: Asks the delegate if an action menu should be displayed for the specified item.

inlineContent.text: The collection view object that is making the request.
The index path of the affected item.
if the editing menu should be shown positioned near the item and pointing to it or
If the user tap-holds a certain item in the collection view, this method (if implemented) is invoked first. Return
if you want to permit the editing menu to be displayed. Return
if the editing menu shouldn’t be shown—for example, you might return
if the corresponding item contains data that should not be copied or pasted over.
If you do not implement this method, the default return value is

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that manages an ordered collection of data items and presents them using customizable layouts.
The methods adopted by the object you use to manage user interactions with items in a collection view.
Asks the delegate if it can perform the specified action on an item in the collection view.
Returns a context menu configuration for the item at a point.
Tells the delegate to perform the specified action on an item in the collection view.
Returns the destination view when dismissing a context menu.
Returns a view to override the default preview the collection view created.
Asks the delegate if an action menu should be displayed for the specified item.
Asks the delegate for the index path to use when moving an item.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
An object containing a list of indexes that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A list of indexes that together represent the path to a specific location in a tree of nested arrays.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
